newsitem.title: UK: Glaxo sells U.S. pharmaceutical plant.
newsitem.headline: Glaxo sells U.S. pharmaceutical plant.

text.p: Britain's Glaxo Wellcome Plc said on Thursday that it is selling its pharmaceutical production plant in Greenville, North Carolina, U.S. to Catalytica Pharmaceuticals Inc for 150 million stg.
The drugs giant said in a statement that the cash proceeds from the sale will be used to reduce group borrowings.
Glaxo will also receive 250,000 shares of preferred stock in Catalytica, plus warrants to purchase two million shares of common stock at $12 per share.
Glaxo added that it may also share in the operating profits from Catalytica Pharmaceuticals' operation of the sterile products facility at the Greenville site up to a maximum 15 million stg.
It will also continue to source products from the site for the next five years at a cost of around 488 million stg.
The sale is set to close by the end of July and Catalytica is expected to keep a "substantial majority" of the 1,100 workers at the plant.
